Package it.polimi.ingsw.network.client.communication

Class CommunicationHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.network.client.communication.CommunicationHandler
  • public class CommunicationHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    A CommunicationHandler offers a transparent way to interact with the remote server-side application. It wraps the ServerCommunicationInterface and offers simplified primitives to carry information through the network layer to the Server and retrieve them from remote.
    See Also:
    ServerCommunicationInterface

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  CommunicationHandler.Interface
      The communication Interface type available to interact with the remote Server.

      The lower bound port assignable to a host.
      static int UPPER_BOUND_PORT
      The upper bound port assignable to a host.
      private java.lang.String username
      The Client username with which results to be registered into the remote Server.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CommunicationHandler

        public CommunicationHandler​(java.lang.String hostAddress,
                            int port,
                            CommunicationHandler.Interface interfaceType)
                     throws ConnectionException
        This is the only constructor. It creates a new CommunicationHandler from the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        hostAddress - the Server ip address to connect to.
        port - the Server port to listen from.
        interfaceType - the preferred communication method to interact with the remote Server.
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - if any specific exception is thrown during the communication setup.

    • Method Detail

      • getUsername

        public java.lang.String getUsername()
        Returns the Client username with which he results to be registered into the Server.
        Returns:
        the Client username.

      • getLobbyName

        public java.lang.String getLobbyName()
        Returns the Lobby name in which the Client may be logged into.
        Returns:
        the Lobby name.

      • sendMessage

        private void sendMessage​(NetworkMessage message)
                  throws ConnectionException
        Sends the given NetworkMessage to the remote Server using the desired ServerCommunicationInterface.
        Parameters:
        message - the NetworkMessage to be sent.
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - if any specific exception is thrown during the send process.

      • nextMessage

        private NetworkMessage nextMessage()
                            throws ConnectionException
        Returns the next NetworkMessage received from the remote Server, ignoring the PING_MESSAGE messages. Note that tis is a blocking call, meaning that this method returns only when a new NetworkMessage is available from the underlying communication interface.
        Returns:
        the next NetworkMessage.
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - if any specific exception is thrown during the receiving process.

      • deliver

        public void deliver​(Deliverable deliverable)
             throws ConnectionException
        Sends a Deliverable object to the remote server by encapsulating into a lower level NetworkMessage.
        Parameters:
        deliverable - the Deliverable object to be sent.
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - if any specific exception is thrown during the send process.

      • nextDeliverable

        public Deliverable nextDeliverable()
                            throws ConnectionException
        Returns the next deliverable sent from the remote Server by extraction from a lower level NetworkMessage. Note that tis is a blocking call, meaning that this method returns only when a new Deliverable is available.
        Returns:
        the next Deliverable from the remote Server.
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - if any specific exception is thrown during the receiving process.

      • register

        public void register​(java.lang.String username)
              throws ConnectionException,
                     ClientAlreadyRegisteredException
        Provides a simplified method to perform the registration of a Client to the remote Server with the given username.
        Parameters:
        username - the identifier the Client wants to be registered to the Server with.
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - if any specific exception is thrown during the receiving process.
        ClientAlreadyRegisteredException - if another Client with the same username has already been registered into the remote Server.

      • unregister

        public void unregister()
                throws ConnectionException,
                       ClientNotRegisteredException
        Provides a simplified method to perform an unregistering operation of a Client from a remote Server that corresponds to the username provided during the registration step via register(String).
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - if any specific exception is thrown during the receiving process.
        ClientNotRegisteredException - if no Client in the Servercan be found that matches the given username.

      • initLobby

        public void initLobby​(java.lang.String lobbyName,
                      java.lang.String lobbyPassword)
               throws ConnectionException,
                      LobbyAlreadyExistsException
        Provides a simplified method to initiate a new Lobby. This is done by first creating a new Lobby with the given lobbyName and #lobbyPassword and then perform a login into it, with the the username used to previously register to the remote Server.
        Parameters:
        lobbyName - the name of the new Lobby to be created.
        lobbyPassword - the password for the new Lobby to be created.
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - if any specific exception is thrown during the receiving process.
        LobbyAlreadyExistsException - if another Lobby with the same lobbyName has already been created into the remote Server.

      • login

        public void login​(java.lang.String lobbyName,
                  java.lang.String lobbyPassword)
           throws ConnectionException,
                  LobbyNotFoundException,
                  LobbyFullException,
                  InvalidPasswordException,
                  GameAlreadyStartedException,
                  PlayerAlreadyAddedException
        Provides a simplified method to perform a login operation of the previously registered Client into the selected Lobby indicated by the given lobbyName. It is also required a secret lobbyPassword to access the Lobby in order to prevent undesired Clients to access the selected Lobby.
        Parameters:
        lobbyName - the name of the Lobby to be joined.
        lobbyPassword - the secret password.
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - if any specific exception is thrown during the receiving process.
        LobbyNotFoundException - if no Lobby can be found that matches the given lobbyName.
        LobbyFullException - if the selected Lobby has reached its maximum Client capacity.
        InvalidPasswordException - if the given lobbyPassword does not match with the actual Lobby password.
        GameAlreadyStartedException - if the Game related to the selected Lobby has already been started and no other Client can join the Lobby anymore.
        PlayerAlreadyAddedException - if another Player with the same username has already been registered into the specified Lobby.

      • logout

        public void logout()
            throws ConnectionException
        Provides a simplified method to perform alogout operation from the Lobby he is actually logged into, referenced from lobbyName.
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - if any specific exception is thrown during the receiving process.

      • getPreGameInfoUpdate

        public NetworkMessage getPreGameInfoUpdate()
                                    throws ConnectionException
        Returns the pre-game information needed to update the list of Players connected to the same Lobby and the time left before the Game can start.
        Returns:
        the desired pre-game information.
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - if any specific exception is thrown during the receiving process.

      • requestLobbyUpdate

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> requestLobbyUpdate()
                                                                          throws ConnectionException
        Provides a simplified way to request an update of the Lobby list currently available into the Server.
        Returns:
        the requested Lobby list update
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - if any specific exception is thrown during the receiving process.
